result.execSummary:
The defendant Abner Aviles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: reflects 07-22-16 court order for 108 days of sentence credit on count 2
Original Transcript (19 pages) commencing 6/10/2016 SENTENCING HEARING, received and filed.  vk
Count two.  Per Order signed on 7/22/2016:  "JOC shall be amended to include 108 days of sentence credit on count two".
Amending Judgment of Conviction; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify sentence credit on count two.
Count one.
Count two.
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Abner Aviles in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Abner Aviles in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of TWENTY-FOUR (12) MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2 AND 14CF3955., with credit for ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHT DAYS (108) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is TWELVE (12) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWELVE (12) MONTHS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of SIX (6) MONTHS.  Credit for ZERO (0) DAYS time served.  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 AND 14CF3955.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain  vocational training.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
* Court ordered Defendant's motor vehicle operating privileges SUSPENDED for a period of SIX (6) MONTHS.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Abner Aviles in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Abner Aviles in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg  

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 33.

Defendant Abner Aviles in court with attorney Debra J Patterson for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

DTC - PHASE I

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held coloquy with the Defendant.  State moved to REVOKE the DTC/DPA.  Defense requested that the Court withhold the Revocation at this time.  Defense did concede that Defendant is out of time in the program.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Case set for Return on Warrant. Attorneys notified.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter was calendared for 09:30am, it is now 04:30pm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Abner Aviles in court with attorney Dawn M Rablin for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

DTC - PHASE I

Review Hearing proceeds. Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 0 (ZERO) points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Abner Aviles in court with attorney Debra Patterson for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Court advised the defendant that he may not possess any dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal and carry permit.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Abner Aviles in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Abner Aviles in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case transferred to br 33 for drug treatment court admissions on 8-05-2015 at 1:30pm.  cmt
